person.persName: James W. Perry (Graves County, Kentucky, tavern keeper, farmer and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer, tavern keeper, and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Permelia Jones Perry. Father of Mary Perry, Amanda Perry, John Perry, Benjamin F. Perry, Charles M. Perry, James A. Perry, and Marion W. Perry. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Graves County in 1850. Tavern keeper in Graves County in 1859. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Mounted Rifles Battalion (C.S.A.) as a private from October 26, 1861 to November 9, 1861. Reported as deserted on November 9, 1861.
